intro: Mespilodaphne bernieri, commonly known as the Madagascar mallow, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical rainforests. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
